98.0: The ultrathin diamond coated quartz glass exhibited a high optical transparency of 90% in air and 98% underwater in UV–Vis range; and its transmittance in IR range (85%) was even 10% higher than that of uncoated quartz.
92.0: In air, the ultrathin film with a thickness of 50 nm achieved a transmittance up to 90% in the UV–Vis range (180–800 nm), which was close to that of bare quartz (92%), whereas the transmittance of the diamond film with thickness of 100 nm possessed a transmittance of 57% (Fig. 3a).

95.0: Even PF-TMMS exhibited high transmittance (> 95%), but the transmittance of PF-TMMS was decreased by introducing the fluorine moiety because the fluorinated silica particles could scatter light.

99.5: The highest transmittance value of 99.5% was achieved on fused silica optical glass substrate with a design wavelength of 500nm, as seen in Fig. 4.

91.2: The transmittance of surface increased from 91.2% (bare glass slide) to 94% (glass slide coated with silicon nanofilaments).
94.0: The transmittance of surface increased from 91.2% (bare glass slide) to 94% (glass slide coated with silicon nanofilaments).
